title: Sokoban (SLASH'EM)
data:
| Sokoban levels                                      |                                                 |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 2–9 of [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | No                                              |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                             |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                              |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | all but bottom level                            |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                              |

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), **[Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban")** has 15 additional maps, giving each level 4-5 variants. As in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the prize is either a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") or an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection"). Both outcomes are equally likely. The amulet is more valuable than the bag, since [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") or [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") (with a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") or the [gnome](/wiki/Gnome "Gnome")'s [tinker](/wiki/Tinker "Tinker") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique")) can produce a bag of holding.

There are also new ways to cheat in Sokoban, such as the new [liquid leap](/wiki/Liquid_leap "Liquid leap") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique"). However, many of these additional ways to cheat also incur a [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") penalty.

## Levels

The entrance to Sokoban (an upstairs [staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")) is located between levels 6 and 10 inclusive in the [Dungeons of Doom](/wiki/Dungeons_of_Doom "Dungeons of Doom"), just below the [Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)").

html:
Sokoban (SLASH'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Sokoban levels
Location Level 2–9 of
Sokoban
Bones No
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No
Diggable floor all but bottom level
Diggable walls No

In SLASH'EM, Sokoban has 15 additional maps, giving each level 4-5 variants. As in NetHack, the prize is either a bag of holding or an amulet of reflection. Both outcomes are equally likely. The amulet is more valuable than the bag, since upgrading a sack or oilskin sack (with a potion of gain level or the gnome's tinker technique) can produce a bag of holding.

There are also new ways to cheat in Sokoban, such as the new liquid leap technique. However, many of these additional ways to cheat also incur a Luck penalty.

Levels

The entrance to Sokoban (an upstairs staircase) is located between levels 6 and 10 inclusive in the Dungeons of Doom, just below the Oracle.
